HMO Officer Job at Mobonike Hospital and Maternity




        
    

        
        Mobonike Hospital and Maternity is a health management company located in Dopemu, Agege, Lagos State.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HMO Officer

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos

Requirements
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications and relevant experience.


Method of Application 
Interested candidates should send their handwritten application letter, Curriculum Vitae and other relevant credentials to: omobonikehospital@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
Or
Should submit hard copies to:
The Admin,
Mobonike Hospital,
33 / 42, Surulere Street, Baale Bus Stop,
Dopemu Agege, Lagos State.

Note: For more information, contact 07084049769.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Procurement Team Lead",
  "description": "Eko Maintenance Limited is a rapidly growing Facility Management Company that specializes in the maintenance of high-rise building facilities with offices located in Victoria Island, Lagos.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Procurement Team Lead

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are looking for a Procurement Team Lead to oversee and manage our procurement operation, ensuring the acquisition of goods and services while maintaining strong vendor relationships.
	The Ideal candidate should be a strategic thinker with excellent leadership skills and deep understanding of Supply chain Management, developing procurement strategies, negotiating contracts and ensure compliance with company policies and industry regulations.


Responsibilities


	Team Leadership: Guide, manage, and mentor the procurement team, fostering a positive and collaborative environment.
	Strategy Development: Develop and implement innovative procurement strategies aligned with company objectives and cost-saving goals.
	Supplier Management: Source, evaluate, and select suppliers, negotiate contracts to secure favourable terms, and maintain strong, long-term vendor relationships.
	Process Management: Oversee the end-to-end procurement process, including requisitions, purchasing, receiving, and invoicing.
	Cost Control: Monitor budgets, analyse procurement expenditures, identify cost-saving opportunities, and track key performance indicators (KPIs).
	Compliance: Ensure all procurement activities comply with company policies, relevant laws, and regulatory requirements.
	Collaboration: Work closely with internal departments to understand their procurement needs and ensure timely delivery of goods and services.
	Performance Improvement: Monitor supplier and team performance, identify areas for process improvement, and implement solutions to enhance efficiency and productivity.
	Reporting: Prepare and present reports on procurement activities, expenditures, and cost savings to management.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s and Masters Degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related field
	8+ years of experience in procurement or supply chain management
	2 + years of experience in a leadership or supervisory role
	Experience in Purchasing construction and mechanical tool is an added advantage.
	Must have a strong background in facility management and proven experience in international procurement.
	Strong negotiation and contract management skills
	Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities
	Proficiency in procurement software and Microsoft Office Suites
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
	Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines
	Knowledge of Procurement regulations and compliance standards
	Experience with supplier relationship management.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment2@ekomaintenance.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-06",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-07",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

Procurement Team Lead Job at Eko Maintenance Limited




        
    

        
        Eko Maintenance Limited is a rapidly growing Facility Management Company that specializes in the maintenance of high-rise building facilities with offices located in Victoria Island, Lagos.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Team Lead

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a Procurement Team Lead to oversee and manage our procurement operation, ensuring the acquisition of goods and services while maintaining strong vendor relationships.
	The Ideal candidate should be a strategic thinker with excellent leadership skills and deep understanding of Supply chain Management, developing procurement strategies, negotiating contracts and ensure compliance with company policies and industry regulations.


Responsibilities


	Team Leadership: Guide, manage, and mentor the procurement team, fostering a positive and collaborative environment.
	Strategy Development: Develop and implement innovative procurement strategies aligned with company objectives and cost-saving goals.
	Supplier Management: Source, evaluate, and select suppliers, negotiate contracts to secure favourable terms, and maintain strong, long-term vendor relationships.
	Process Management: Oversee the end-to-end procurement process, including requisitions, purchasing, receiving, and invoicing.
	Cost Control: Monitor budgets, analyse procurement expenditures, identify cost-saving opportunities, and track key performance indicators (KPIs).
	Compliance: Ensure all procurement activities comply with company policies, relevant laws, and regulatory requirements.
	Collaboration: Work closely with internal departments to understand their procurement needs and ensure timely delivery of goods and services.
	Performance Improvement: Monitor supplier and team performance, identify areas for process improvement, and implement solutions to enhance efficiency and productivity.
	Reporting: Prepare and present reports on procurement activities, expenditures, and cost savings to management.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s and Masters Degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related field
	8+ years of experience in procurement or supply chain management
	2 + years of experience in a leadership or supervisory role
	Experience in Purchasing construction and mechanical tool is an added advantage.
	Must have a strong background in facility management and proven experience in international procurement.
	Strong negotiation and contract management skills
	Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities
	Proficiency in procurement software and Microsoft Office Suites
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
	Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines
	Knowledge of Procurement regulations and compliance standards
	Experience with supplier relationship management.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment2@ekomaintenance.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Call Representative",
  "description": "Prowbys Innovation Limited - We craft innovative digital solutions that transform businesses and elevate user experiences. Our team of experts combines creativity, technology, and strategies to deliver exceptional solutions. From concept to launch, we bring bold ideas to life.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Call Representative

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Internship

Job Description


	We&#39;re looking for a motivated individual (Female) to join our tech team, we specialize in offering technology driven solution to various parastatals.
	As a tcall representative, you&#39;ll drive business growth by making calls, negotiating deals, and building relationships with potential clients and partners.


Key Responsibilities


	Make outbound calls and negotiate business opportunities
	Build relationships with key decision-makers
	Identify new business opportunities and generate leads
	Collaborate with the team to develop business strategies.


Requirements


	NYSC / Intern
	Must be a Female
	Excellent communication and negotiation skills
	Strong business acumen and understanding of market trends
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office.


What We Offer


	Salary: N30,000 - N50,000 / month.
	Competitive salary + commission.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;info@prowbys.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2026-01-01",

  },

}



Call Representative Job at Prowbys Innovation Limited




        
    

        
        Prowbys Innovation Limited - We craft innovative digital solutions that transform businesses and elevate user experiences. Our team of experts combines creativity, technology, and strategies to deliver exceptional solutions. From concept to launch, we bring bold ideas to life.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Call Representative

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Internship

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We're looking for a motivated individual (Female) to join our tech team, we specialize in offering technology driven solution to various parastatals.
	As a tcall representative, you'll drive business growth by making calls, negotiating deals, and building relationships with potential clients and partners.


Key Responsibilities


	Make outbound calls and negotiate business opportunities
	Build relationships with key decision-makers
	Identify new business opportunities and generate leads
	Collaborate with the team to develop business strategies.


Requirements


	NYSC / Intern
	Must be a Female
	Excellent communication and negotiation skills
	Strong business acumen and understanding of market trends
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office.


What We Offer


	Salary: N30,000 - N50,000 / month.
	Competitive salary + commission.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: info@prowbys.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Openings at Grand Oak Limited
content:
Grand Oak Limited (GOL) is part of a team committed to working together across companies. Only by sharing ideas, technologies and talents can the Group achieve and sustain profitable growth Keeping Commitment. We believe that following through on promises is the best way to maintain credibility with colleagues, employees and customers Continuous Improvement.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Forklift Operator

Job Location: Sango Ota, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a reliable and safety-conscious Warehouse Forklift Operator to support daily warehouse operations.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for operating forklifts and other material-handling equipment to load, unload, move, and store goods efficiently and safely within the warehouse.


Key Responsibilities


	Operate forklifts and pallet jacks to load, unload, and move materials.
	Receive, stack, and organize goods in designated warehouse areas.
	Ensure all goods are handled safely and stored according to company standards.
	Conduct routine checks and basic maintenance of forklifts before and after use.
	Assist with inventory management by recording materials moved and updating stock records.
	Follow all safety regulations, operational guidelines, and company policies.
	Support general warehouse tasks such as packaging, labeling, and order picking when required.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Intereted candidates should possess an SSCE with 1–3 years of experience as a Forklift Operator or in a warehouse environment.
	Valid forklift operator certification or license.
	Knowledge of warehouse operations and safety procedures.
	Good physical stamina and ability to lift or move heavy materials when needed.
	Attention to detail and strong work ethic.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Preferred Skills:


	Basic computer or inventory system knowledge.
	Experience operating different types of forklifts (e.g., reach truck, counterbalance).


Salary
N80,000 - N150,000 / Month.

Application Closing Date: 15th November, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Truck Driver

Job Location: Akure, Ondo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a reliable and experienced 5-Ton Truck Driver to transport goods safely and efficiently to various destinations.
	The ideal candidate must have a valid driver’s license, knowledge of road safety regulations, and experience operating medium-duty trucks.
	The driver will ensure timely deliveries while maintaining the truck in good working condition and adhering to company policies.


Key Responsibilities


	Operate and drive a 5-ton truck to transport goods and materials
	Ensure proper loading and unloading of cargo to prevent damage
	Conduct daily pre-trip and post-trip vehicle inspections
	Maintain a clean and safe vehicle at all times
	Plan routes and meet delivery schedules
	Follow all traffic laws and safety procedures
	Monitor vehicle performance and report any faults or required maintenance
	Maintain accurate logbooks, delivery notes, and other required documentation
	Assist warehouse staff when necessary
	Ensure customer satisfaction through timely and professional service.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Minimum SSCE/High School Certificate
	Valid driver’s license (appropriate category for truck class)
	Proven experience driving 5-ton trucks or similar vehicles
	Good knowledge of road networks and safety regulations
	Strong attention to detail and high sense of responsibility
	Physically fit and able to lift/load goods when required
	Good communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to work under minimal supervision.


Additional Skills (Optional):


	Basic mechanical knowledge
	Experience with GPS and route planning applications.


Salary
N80,000 - N150,000 per month.

Application Closing Date: 18th November, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

3.) Boiler Operator

Job Location: Sango Ota, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Boiler Operator is responsible for operating, maintaining, and monitoring steam boilers and related mechanical systems to ensure safe and efficient plant operations.
	The role involves conducting regular inspections, performing routine maintenance, and troubleshooting equipment issues to minimize downtime and maintain production standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Operate and monitor boilers, feedwater systems, and auxiliary equipment.
	Maintain optimal boiler performance by adjusting valves, controls, and safety devices.
	Conduct regular inspections and preventive maintenance on boilers and equipment.
	Record operating data such as pressure, temperature, water levels, and fuel consumption.
	Identify and troubleshoot operational issues, reporting faults to maintenance teams.
	Ensure compliance with safety standards and environmental regulations.
	Maintain accurate logs and documentation of daily operations.
	Support shutdowns, startups, and emergency response procedures as required.


Qualifications and Experience


	OND or Technical Diploma in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering (or related field).
	2 - 3 years of experience as a Boiler Operator or in a similar industrial role.
	Knowledge of boiler systems, steam generation, and mechanical operations.
	Understanding of safety and environmental standards related to boiler operations.
	Strong attention to detail and ability to work under minimal supervision.


Skills:


	Technical troubleshooting and maintenance skills.
	Good communication and teamwork abilities.
	Strong safety awareness.
	Record-keeping and reporting accuracy.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 15th November, 2025.

Click here to apply online

     

    

        Click here to Apply
